JSL¶

Release v0.0.1.

Introduction¶

JSL is a Python DSL for describing JSON schemas.

JSL stands for JSON Schema Language.

Examples¶

>>> infer('''
... {% for row in items|batch(3, '&nbsp;') %}
...     {% for column in row %}
...         {% if column.has_title %}
...             {{ column.title }}
...         {% else %}
...             {{ column.desc|truncate(10) }}
...         {% endif %}
...     {% endfor %}
... {% endfor %}
... ''')
{
    'items': [{
        'desc': <scalar>,
        'has_title': <unknown>,
        'title': <scalar>
    }]
}

How It Works¶

Installation¶

$ pip install jsl

API¶

  • API

Contributing¶

The project is hosted on GitHub. Please feel free to send a pull request or open an issue.

Running the Tests¶

$ pip install -r ./requirements-dev.txt
$ ./test.sh
